reviewText:
In car camera, in wet conditions, the rain droplets on the car are moving differently to the car movement, it looks really ugly and spoils the expereince.

There seems to be a wierd graphical effect like chromatic aberration which looks stupid and can't be turned off.

Side mirrors rear view of scenery and cars are chugging like at 10 fps where as normal forward view graphics are running at normal speeds.

I must say though, the graphics themselves are not next gen at all, very pastelly and dull, instead of vibrant and normal looking, i hope they can patch this, a damn shame.

Using a T300 Wheel, each time i load up, i have to re select the T300 wheel in the controller settings as it seems to default back to keyboard/mouse.

I have to change the rotation speed of the T300 to 360 in the Thrustmaster control panel from windows desktop, i thought codemsters programmed it to work straight away?

Running an unlooped benchmark, it crashes back to the desktop every time.

reviewText:
For ♥♥♥♥'s sake Codemasters I knew there was a high posibility of not delivering much inovation to the series, but you seriously gave the gamers a ♥♥♥♥ing downgraded game! I mean how more could you ♥♥♥♥ this up? I think you can't be more dissapointed since your expectations are so low. How on earth can you give your customers a product such as F1 2015? And I am not even mentioning the bugs that come with the game (which luckily did not occure to me)!

Since I started with a negatively very bad introduction I'll try to talk about the pros. First of all the number one thing I was desprately waiting for was the inprovment of the AI cars. This year i could finally say the AI  cars are a challenge and gives the game a tromendous amount of depth which makes the races attractive in so many levels compared to the previous F1 games from Codies, but it took them 5 years to improve such a basic gameplay tool that should be a priority in every racing game! And ladies and gentlemen that's about it when it comes to gameplay improvment.
There is also an improvment in the graphics and it's nice to see a visual difference in F1 2015 and previous F1 games. I could insist it looks next gen, but isn't mind blowing.

Now the cons: It seemed to me that the developers were mostly interested in the graphic upgrade like better looking environments, faces and the engineers ,which is completely pointless since all of the character models are acting the same just like in other pre-race start. It definitely does not make my Formula 1 experience more authentic regardlessly on how much the graphics are in depth of detail. If I get to see the same ♥♥♥♥ over and over again it just gets annoying (same thing about the comentary). I'd rather just have a simple menu were I could use my imagination instead of forcing my self to enjoy something  I'm used to see a lot of amount of times. Some drivers do look pretty neat and some do look literally disgusting like for example Maldonado.
The worst thing about this game is the missing content. At first I was amazed by it, but after trying to play a different single player mode instead of just playing quick race, champions mode or time trail I started to realize there is nothing really else to do in this game, but wait you say there is multiplayer? Well i say multiplayer is pure ♥♥♥♥. I spent a week playing this game and I could not even once find a multiplayer session. Codemasters won't let you even create an open lobby session, You can only play with your freinds, but if you wanna race with the rest of the world you can use their innovative" multiplayer modes which don't have a single player in it!
And the last thing I would like to mention is one of the important aspect of the game that has a big part on how the game runs is the LACK OF SAFETY CAR. I have simply no words for not including such an important game feature that was in the previous games. You say it will be patched sooner or later? That makes it look like that the game is still in early access alpha god damn it!

When it comes to gameplay features this game is definety fun
date: but this innovative feature of the game cannot save it from the overall lack of content.\n\n6/10"

reviewText:
Absolute Garbage.

I have watched and loved f1 since 1994 and played the games since 1995.  F1 97 is still more enjoyable than this effort from these money grabbing goons.  Hang your heads in shame, Codemasters!

The PC version should look absolutely stunning now that the consoles versions are next gen" but somehow it looks worse than last year in some areas.

The handling is quite nice once you get a feel for it but the braking is very unpredictable and you can't trail brake like you would in PCars/Corsa/Iracing etc.

There seems to be a new glitch every 30s.  If you use a flashback from terminal damage the game will continue to run in black and white once you have continued.  You seem to get constantly kicked from online lobbys just as the race is about to begin.  Online there is a gearbox bug that means you are always in the limiter no matter what gear you  use.  As with previous games you need to use vsync for your wheel to work properly.  If you decide to restart a race it will put you in neutral.  To top it all off you will constantly be kicked back to your desktop.

Well done."

reviewText:
I'm DONE codes and so should everyone else that has stuck by you for the last few years of me·di·oc·ri·ty.

At this time there is NO MOD suport (codes went out of their way to make it harder to tweak their new ERB files), which means:

-Your stuck with GARBAGE sound
-Okay to Bad FFB
-no way to make AI faster
-No way for someone to make a F1 2016 fantasy season / or anything Fantasy at all / that means NO cars, helmets, pit -crew, etc.
-no up to date track updates like signs

Warning RANT in: 3,2,1

For the most part Codes people have tolerated your BS becuase you've got a stranglehold on F1 and you've looked the other way in reagards to MODS, but with your NEW, but NOT NEW, game engine (game looks better and worse on PC then your other titles) you went and FU@$ your players. I can understand codes baby, I can, it hurts the pride when moders make your game better then you can, but to go out of the way to make it MOD UNFRIENDLY is just crazy stupid.

First things first, audio is trash, I know the new v6 engines don't sound as great as last gen cars, but they don't sound this bad, Its F1 not lawnmower man. Do the f1 teams not let you near their cars codes, why can't you get a proper sound recording of the engines (moders can).

Why can I not change my viewing angle? ACorsa, Pcars, Iracing, etc all let me, so why then Codes dont you. There is this little something sim racers like to do and thats GETTING A PROPER FOV based on screen size and viewing distance you FU@$ ♥♥♥♥♥. (MODers let me)

So you got Anthony Davidson, who does a bit of the simulation stuff for Mercedes, as your handling consultant and In terms of detailed feedback, it's Anthony first and foremost. So I've never driven an F1 car, but if this was going to be a SIM like you said over and over should the wheel have high speed vibrations? (yes), snap over or understeer?(yes). I've played the f1 mod for ACorsa and they got them in there. Did you do ANYTHING the real drivers said.

Their is NOWAY Lewis played this game and liked it (Codes stated he gave it a go on many occasions) I bet he was like damn its just like driving the real thing

reviewText:
I will be concise

The game. Is. Hm glitchy :3

Ok now seriously

The positives:

- New handling model, on the first try i utterly hated it but now i got used to it and realised the game has the most realistic handling model i have ever tried (haven't played sim games tho to compare).
- Improved sounds, it reminds me more of the cars i hear on real f1, unlike f1 2014 where ferrari had completely different engine sounds, and zero physic sounds. Now they all come to play.
- I would say slightly improved graphics, tho i was awaiting for more, it's just seems an up-resed version with better reflections and lighting system. But i will also put the negatives about the graphics here, as i said there isn't much improvement on colours etc. It seems the same engine to me. The lighting on some places is utterly bad, i mean how are the legs of the drivers able to be so bright? they are under the car, they should be shadowed, and i wonder how i am the only one so far who talks about it. The shadows on some cars especially under the mirrors or above the wheel, are only pixels bigger than my fingers, and generally they could have done a much better job with graphics.
- The commentary pre and after race, in addition to the grid showcase put some life realism into the game, but for some point after, the commentary isn't something special, it get's boring.

Now the negatives:

I actually have no idea from where to start about. I might say the same things as other guys said thought i only read a few reviews, because i bet most of the problems are problems that we all have
- No career mode. No need to discuss that further.
- No safety car. No need to discuss that too.
- Single player glitches. For instance those only a few i found since day one:
Pit stop glitch
Time Trial Glitch
Not to mention many others like top speed failures some times, being on mercs with drs and sleepstream and the mclaren gets away, or AI crashing like hell sometimes. Anyway
- They removed the old system lobby, to be able to search for an exact custom race and find it. Now it's almost impossible for example if a big youtuber hosts a lobby, they is no way people can join, unless the hosts invite them. Unbeleavable.
- Even with the removed old system lobby, we hoped we could do some racing on the standard types of races the game offers. No way this could have happened. Even u can't join a lobby, if you can, there might be a race winner since lights go out, if it doesn't people will dc or get dsq on pit stops, or people might be driving on the same lobby, different circuits and the same times. WTF IS THIS. Multiplayer=UNPLAYABLE
-Enough. I already got tired i have no more energy to think of other negatives xD

IN CONCLUSION:  I think the game has a lot  of potential with the new handling etc. Codies just fcked it up with the features and glitches. About the glitches, there is a high posibility they gonna fix them soon via patch. About the features, I HAVE NO CLUE what they were thinking when they said oh let's remove career mode it will make the game better" or "let's change the lobbies style
date: now people are forced to wait to play on a random lobby instead of joining through a list of available hosts".\nThe game is restrictive and bad at the momment

helpfulPercent: challenging on time trial etc. So I should not recomment this game

votesFunny: slightly improved graphics in general
commentsCount:
and the potential of being a good game after they sort of the glitches.

:P"

reviewText:
What can i say, the game is great, but lacking in so many ways, and i wish steam had a Neutral rating aswell.

First off lets start with the positives.

The handling model really seems to be upgraded, and i really enjoy the racing. way more than before!
AI is okay, more agressive than before, and faster!
Pro mode is a good concept. (More on that later though.)
Driving in rain is fairly good looking with offset TVPod. And actually in general.
The engineer stuff is pretty immersive, and he will update you aswell with info etc.
Tyre wear seems great so far and you can really feel your grip go, and feel if you are hard on them or not.
Game seems to run well, and stable maxed out. 4690k / 970.

Negatives.
Stripped features, that were in previous games like :
No Scenario mode.
No Co-Op season.
No career mode.
Full qualifying but 50% race? nope.

It feels bareboned at best sadly.

Raindrops on your screen is worse than f1 2014. Very blurry, can barely tell its supposed to be drops.
Lackluster settings, like chromatic abberation and blur having to be manually killed off in the config.
Come on codemasters, Windows 8 has voice recognition aswell, you COULD have added that feature for PC aswell.
Pro mode is manual gears only, and i feel that isn't really okay. We should still have the option of manual/auto.
Tire models seem almost too clean? Grass to rubber transition is instant instead of wearing off slowly etc.
Multiplayer not finding any games for me /will be edited out when it does.
Multiplay lobbies are friends only , right now it seems.
Game is beautiful, but doesn't look like the next gen stuff from the trailers.
If they are going to add Podium cutscenes, at least pull them off right, the funny music is extremely anti climactic, and no champagne spraying etc.
Drivers hugging /Arm around the shoulders... LOL.
FFB.

I'm very sad, because i really wanted to give it a good review, but as of right now, it's not going to get one, Next gen game with stripped/missing features, that's not cool codies. Not cool at all! Let me guess, it's coming with DLC? I don't want to even think that, but it does smell like it in all honesty. The driving itself is brilliant, but the game just doesn't have enough content.

< Very sad camper!

reviewText: The hype and buildup from Codemasters over the last 6 months or so, had this billed as a big step forward in F1 games, constantly talking about realism etc. This couldn't be further from the truth, and it says it all that I only have 10 minutes of play time clocked up. It's a console game that happens to run on a PC. Total arcade experience. Playing on a Logitech G27 wheel + pedals you very very quickly realise this is designed to be played with a controller, on a console, and is not trying to be in any way a race simulator. I will stick with Project Cars and Asseto Corsa - actual race simulators, or as close as we have today. Codemasters, how I wish you could go back and play TOCA Touring Cars 2, to remind yourself when you used to know what you were doing.\n\nRefund requested, for the first time ever on Steam :(

reviewText:
I've played the Codemasters F1 series since the 2010 reboot of the series, when F1 2015 launched on pre-order, I purchased, waited for the launch, and played on the first hour after release just to find myself at the same time happy and dissapointed.

PROS
-The gameplay was polished and feels realistic, with all the lateral g-force effect that you might expect when cornering at 220km/h

-The new TV Cockpit Offset camera was an improvement from the last installment.

-The 2014 and 2015 seasons together made possible to drive in the same game the Hockenheinring GP and Mexican GP.

CONS
-No Tyres, sometimes, when you're driving and turn your camera lateral or backwards, the tyres simply disappear and your car runs with a floating rim.

-Random crashes, on the replay, benchmark, on quitting the game.

-FPS Drops, running at smooth 50fps on Canada, paused the game, resumed and the game dropped to 7fps, and stayted that way until an Alt+Tab

-Malfunctioning Flag rules, I was braking at the entrace of a corner, and Hamilton crashed at my back, I was disclassified for causing and accident.

-I cannot play 25% Race with full quali.

-No Career mode

Final Note: 4/10 - This game has potential, if not broken as Maldonado's car.

reviewText:
Wow, thats all I can say. What a mix of emotions from this game.
I'll start from the start, but before I do, Im not going to mention any sort of bugs or anything like that, just the game itself.
Negatives:
- I really enjoyed having my own career so not being able to play as myself only as a current racer really really sucks for me and is probably for me the most disappointing thing so far.
- The second thing that really annoys me is the fact you cant edit the race distance which sucks. There's 3 settings of race distance and you cant edit that at all.
- I enjoyed the Young Drivers Test in the 2013 game and thought it added a lot to it as a real career. In this game the first time you get to drive in career mode is the first practice session. To live the full experience of F1, there should be young drivers test and pre Season testing to learn to drive the car and even set up tips etc.

I havent played a lot of the game yet but these are just some things I feel.

Now positive:
- I like the 2014-15 change over, not sure if it does, but I hope you can start the career in 2014 then at the end of the year it goes to 2015.
- The new look start up menu looks good, and the start of each session with Crofty (As much as I dont like him or his voice) is pretty cool i suppose.
- The new interactions with the drivers and engineers like the setup with the tablet, the pop up menu in the race, etc and the new setup options aswell.

This is all I have so far but I will start playing a bit more and see how it goes.

reviewText:
So I previously had a review for this game which was quite negative. Now some time has passed since the initial realese and some additional hours have been added to the playtime.

So lets revamp this on how I feel about this game at this state;

A lot of talk was about the game crashing which I previously didn't have any trouble with. However, I had stated that the game loaded very slowly which I can happily say no longer seems to be a case.

I'd spoke a little about the graphics, I still don't truely belive there is any difference graphically compared to the other games. It has improved, there are lower flickers and edges, but there are still some common graphical issues that do occur!

The game options have now been updated and finally do stick when you've selected them, so no more fiddle faddeling just to set up a game.

The sound is still fundamentally broken! It's a trait through every game I guess...

The AI overall is a lot more challanging, though they do really still make very rookie moves and they have a tendancy to get in front of you and just brake and pull you off the track, causing your race to be ruined :/ sigh...

The controller is still very much broken, a lot of improvements but still it's not where it should be, not even with custom settings. Car is very difficult to steer on steering lock, I could actually go as far as saying keyboard is better for a full lock turn... now that is shocking.

Muliplayer? There practically is none. The hoppers are rubbish and custom matches you'll be lucky to find two or maybe three lobby. Likely when you get into that lobby and start a race, you'll find yourself getting passed by cars because you get ghosted (some weird glitch under braking) or if not that getting thrown into a gravel trap from some freaky alien glitch spinning you several times on the spot then leaping you out into that gravel l o l .. Penalty system.. well, should I say more.. However the timings and connection does seem much more stable, not really a pro though when you consider the other glitches.

Overall it would be an OK game to buy, for £10 or less (if you didn't own any other versions) Though I would probably recommend you to get 2013. Paying anything more though is just asking for dissapointment.

I don't think I can recommend this game still at this time though because I just don't truely believe that it's a finished product. Updates come out rarely and when they do they're not resolving real time issues.

Though that doesn't mean it can't change my mind in the future.

Sort your ♥♥♥♥ out Codematers, and finish this damn game!

reviewText: Rubbish. This is my first steam review as I normally don't bother writing them, but I couldn't let this slide .. the game is terrible. I've come across four bugs in under an hour. First, the keyboard doesn't work for navigating the menus so you can't change default controls (I googled and eventually found if you disconnect all of your controllers you can eventually get it to work), then the left rear wheel just constantly flickers. Then for some reason when I pressed the accelerator the wheels animated and eventually started smoking but the car didn't move at all on track (not a traction control problem, another bug). Then the cinematic cut scenes are garbled too. Another possible bug (not included in the four above) is getting errors when the game tries to communicate with the steam servers (something I've never experienced with any other game). I've played the previous games in the series and quite enjoyed them. If you want a decent racing game at the minute I suggest assetto corsa. Codemasters should be embarrassed. Getting a refund.

reviewText:
No TrackIR support
No SLI support
Barely looks better than last year (and I'm playing on the max settings)

It's Formula One. If you've played the others, you know what to expect - fast cars go around a track. It hasn't really changed all that much, even with the new engine.

For me, it runs decently (i7 4790k@4.5/16GB RAM/SLI 980). Hangs around 80fps, though did drop to 50 at one point. Many people have severe framerate issues though. For what it is, it's not that well optimised if it requires a 970.

What really gets me is the lack of TrackIR support. TrackIR is a headtracking tool that allows you to look around by moving your head in real life. In these racing games, it's really quite useful. Dirt Rally has it. The older F1 titles have it. F1 2015? Nope. If you go into proper first person mode with the camera, you lose half of your mirrors. You can use a button to look left or look right, but this removes the front view. With TrackIR I could just move my head slightly, still be able to see out the front and see the entire mirror.

Handling I found was pretty decent, really light on the Force Feedback though, can be changed in the settings at least.

The AI is not all that great. I'm pretty sure they should avoid crashes whereever possible, but they instead like to just ram me out of the way. Even on the starting grid, I was messing about looking for the look left button and wasn't moving, but a car decided to just drive straight on into me instead. Maybe he should have gone to Specsavers.

They've fixed some crashes, but I still had a crash in the menu.

Sound is poorly mixed. The pit crew is barely audible. From what I can hear, it's some poor voice acting.

Also, it might interest you to know that the console users can communicate with their pit crew via commands over the microphone. Codemasters decided to leave it out of the PC version.

Conclusion: Buy the older titles, this is yet another rubbish port of the console version.

reviewText:
It seems that what they call a 'next-gen' F1 game is releasing an empty game with stripped out features and a glitchy mess.

Pros:
The graphics are a decent step up and runs mostly smooth on my PC.
The handling model and traction feel a lot better than 2014.
The new menus are a nice step up from the plain old ones.
The sound is improved compared to 2014.
Inclusion of the 2014 season.

Cons:
It is quite clear that some graphics though were given more polish than others. The cars look nice and the night tracks have great lighting but the character models still look last-gen.
Not a major con but the commentary can sound pretty forced at times.
The AI is a lot more challenging which is good but at times they don't seem to acknowledge your exsistence and are happy to cut you off, clip your tyre and block you on your qualifying lap.
I can live with not being able to put my name in on career mode but it seems that all depth has been taken out and just feels like a glorified quick race mode.
As someone who does simracing, the force-feedback was pretty lackluster on my G27 wheel.
Various graphical and HUD glitches. (Anyone want to race against floating sets of tyres?)

I didn't even bother with online but from what I've heard it's pretty broken.

I was hoping for big things jumping into next-gen but this feels like an empty and lackluster experience. Probably rushed out to make a quick buck and as the only official F1 game, this is unacceptable. It's not horrible but is slightly above average at best. I wanted to like this game but I couldn't get much out of it. You're better off with F1 2013 which I still consider the best out of Codemaster's F1 lineup.

reviewText:
Edit: Dropped recommendation for now (as of July 14th)
---------------------------------------------------------
So after a year of hiatus, I decided to give a shot on F1 2015. After a few minutes spent on the track, my first impressions are of mixed-bag...

Good:
-Massive improvement on engine (PU) sounds compared to F1 2014
-Significantly better looking than F1 2013.
-Handling is very good (with a joypad)
-Podium Cutscenes (but I don't mind about the in-game narrator)
-Well optimized. Runs at 60fps with a r9 270, i7 4770 on medium/highs after driver update
-Almost instant flashbacks, and because of the AI's behaviour, it's a relief
-Can change race settings during loading

Bad:
-No safety car
-Damage physics are several steps backwards compared to previous installments
-Can't disable texture blur
-Penalty system seems more lenient on crashes
-Split-screen taken away
-The McLaren Honda engine sounds terrific...
-Online features are broken. When I hosted one game, there were 10 players, but when I start the race, all players but one just disappeared and the game kicked me to the main menu due to not enough players". Also when I join a lobby
date: I'm always kicked from the start. Bring back open lobbies
recommended: and fix this please !\n-AI is aggressive on Medium and Hard setting
hoursPlayed: they pushed me several times out of the track.\nWhen they get ahead thanks to DRS and/or a superior power unit
voteText: the AI just changes its trajectory and brakes hard
helpfulPercent:
preventing the player to overtake back and get the nose stuck to their rear-end instead...Can't imagine Pro Mode without flashbacks then (or with a non-Mercedes powered car ).

Mediocre
-...but still sounding dull
votesHelpful: especially on downshifts and in the pit lane\n-lack of personality. I personally appreciate the scrapping of the tutorial mode on single player and the email messaging system on career mode. Championship mode is enough for me
votesTotal:
but I guess I'm in a part of the minority on that one
-the game crashes on exit
-Non realistic practices sessions
-the steering wheel display could display more useful information
-still no installation lap...
-sometimes
votesFunny: the leaderboard is not getting updated in time trial mode (bug)\n-the HUD has not evolved much since F1 2010\n-Penalty system for corner cutting is annoying: it doesn't mind if you cut on Chicane at Spa and gained 1 full second
commentsCount:
but it gives a 10-second penalty (25%race) when putting 2 tires out on 130 R and losing some time at Suzuka. Ridiculous.

Conclusion
The series have been overhauled with a 'new' game engine
column16: but it's hampered by teething issues and limitations so it needs some maturation before the major bugs get ironed out
column17: and more features to come for the next year.\n\n6.3/10."

reviewText:
Update 3 : 21/08/15 : Man, this game just keeps getting worse. I now get full AI opponents in a multiplayer lobby. THat's it. I'm never paying for a Codemasters F1 game ever again.

Update 2 : 04/08/15 : This edit is regarding the 31/07 patch. After playing the game for 4 days after the patch, it seems like the Codies are making slow progress towards fixing the patches. A lot of annoying bugs have been ironed out and framerates during gameplay is also much better but they have yet to fix one major issue with this game and that is MULTIPLAYER. It is more broken now than ever. I just can't find one single lobby or hopper or whatever they're calling it now to play in. This needs a fix and my review will stay negative till then.


Update 1 : 23/07/15 : Okay, it seems the 20/07 patch pushed in by the codies has fixed a few issues like framerate drops and crashes but it does not fix ALL the issues. There are still a few stutters here and there and needs a lot more fixing. The multiplayer is still broken and I'm still getting kicked from sessions for no bloody reason so my recommendation is still a NO.


ORIGINAL REVIEW : This game...this could be so much more than it is right now. I don't know where to begin. This game is just BROKEN.

The graphics are an obvious improvement from the previous titles and the handling seems a bit realistic than before but you buy racing games to have fun and I don't think I've had much fun with this game until now.

The game is marred with bugs and the multiplayer is just broken. I joined a hopper sprint in excitement to play my first ever multiplayer online on this game and the race doesn't start for me. I know this because the other people in the lobby keep screaming at each other that they someone rammed into someone else and he had to lose his front wing, etc. So, I decide to quit and rejoin the hopper. I have no idea how but the hopper shows that I finished second and scored 18 points. As I rejoined the hopper, the other guys got furious at me and started abusing me and questioning me as to how I scored 18 points when I left the lobby and kicked me from the game. What a horrible experience that was. I still haven't come around to playing one single multiplayer game. What a shame!

As to the Championship Mode, it's a meh. I have no idea why Codemasters decided to take away the customization options as to how one approaches a weekend race, be it one shot quali, short weekend or the full weekend experience. All that is gone now and you are left with no choice to play the game by their rules. Such a fail!

The quick race mode is nothing new. Just play a boring single race and come back to the home screen. Not much improvement other than that.

I haven't played the pro-season mode yet and I don't feel like I should be playing it either as you won't have any sort of assists and camera customization options and since I use a keyboard and not a racing wheel, it is almost impossible to control the oversteer on the cars in this game without traction control cranked to full. This is another one of those meh issues in the game.

The graphics are great but the optimization for the PC is terrible. TERRIBLE! This could've been done so much more better. There are also just so many bugs in the game, it just takes away the enjoyment of racing an F1 car. The pit-lane graphics and sounds are just horrible and there are sudden framerate drops all over. There is nothing we can do but hope that the Codies fix this stuff in the coming patches.

If you are really interested in F1 and want to immerse youself in an experience which is enjoyable as well as challenging, I suggest you buy the F1 2010 or 2013 game(s). These guys are just taking more stuff away with every iteration of the game.

reviewText:
So I was just enjoying a race, came into the pits for my first stop and the team in front of me double-stacked their cars, so I was stuck in my pit box stationary for over 20 seconds because I couldn't get out.

Surely that team should have suffered a heavy penalty for that? I don't want that to be removed as it's part of the realism and these things can happen in a race, but A bit more sense from the AI and some penalties would be nice. Oh, just under a lap after I exited the pits my game crashed.

Also I the game looks washed out when it's raining, it looks colourless. It actually gives me a bit of a headache playing more than an hour.

Other than that I love the new wear settings, it's quite realistic (I've yet to see engine wear), but the damage graphics are complete rubbish. It looked so much better in the last 4 games, in this game you don't see anything but you're told that you've taken damage, though it's rare since these cars seem to be built like tanks. Vettel ran into the back of me at speed while I was braking and he continued on without so much as a loss in speed while I spun off and took no damage. It is set to full damage before you ask.

A step up in some ways and a step down in a lot of other ways. Some things that probably won't be fixed and a few bugs that hopefully will, I don't recommend this game as it stands right now.

reviewText:
MY GOD THIS GAME IS SCREWED!
I have played a lot of racing games in the past and have previously played F1 2011, F1 2012 and F1 2014. I was really hyped for this game, but my god they screwed it up.

+Better and cleaner UI
+Better AI, the AI actually overtakes you this time
+Beautiful lighting
+Realistically modeled cars
+You can push the car more due to less unpredictable wheelspin
+Both the 2015 and the 2014 F1 seasons are playable
+Better commentery/tv-style
+Tire sqeal can finally be heard properly

-Game crashes alot
-FPS drops are common, dropping to 9 FPS and staying there very frequently
-Colours are very washed out
-I cannot look back in the 3rd person view
-Engine sounds are far too quiet
-Limited Anti-Aliasing options, WHERE IS MSAA?
-Blur, motion blur cannot be deactivated, WTF?
-No introduction scene before the race start like in previous games
-AI likes to punt you in the wall in some corners, for example Eau Rouge
-The graphics are messed up, everything is very blury and smeary, absolutely horrific, WTF HAPPENED?
-No safety car, WTF ARE YOU THINKING CM?
-No Co-op, WTF ARE YOU THINKING CM?
-FFB is horribly weak and inacurrate, almost no effects, worse than every before in a CM F1 game, WTF HAPPENED?
-Why is it not possible to adjust each session length in championship mode?
-Damage model is pathetic and far too forgiving, wait is this 2005 or 2015?
-Rev counter on the steering wheel is still broken and far too short like in F1 2014
-ALT+TAB does not work properly
-Hardly any tire smoke when locking up
-Long loading times

PC specs: i7 4790k, r9 290, 16GB DDR3, G27 for more info see my profile

All in all I cannot recommend this game in its current state, the game is completely screwed, lacking featuires and will make you want to buy a pair of glasses. To be honest F1 2014 is probaly a better buy. I think I might test Steam's refund policy.

10.07.2015, F1 2015 v.1.0

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
EDIT:

So after raging quite a bit yesterday I completed a few 25% quick races on different tracks with some of the 2015 and 2014 spec F1. Championship mode is literally unplayable due to it bein at 9 FPS the entire time. So in this small list I will go into the actual racing aspect of F1 2015 and the changes compared to last years game.

+Handling model has been vastly improved, more traction, less unpredictable wheelspin, the rear of the car is still quite a challenge which is good
+The AI actually races you this time around, there is lots of wheel to wheel action, and the AI even completes switchback moves and dosen't back out of a move very often
+Pits stops are now just as quick as in real life and the times vary per team and your crew can mess up
+The AI is not as slow on the first lap, like in previous games
+Fuel management is now realistic becuase upshifting early and lifting and coasting actually make a difference
+The AI race each other with realistic consequences
+Front wing gets damags more easily
+The effects of dirty are are noticable
+Wet racing is possible again, due to the AI not being overpowered anymore
+AI make mistakes and it is great to see them having to deal with oversteer and slipping on the grass
+The sparks that fly from the car directly infront of you are implemented very well
+Penalty system usually fairly affects AI cars
+Racing is just more fun with all cars batteling each other a lot of the time, going 3-wide into corners and stuff like that
+AI causes crashes
+More cinematics, grid walk podium etc.
+You can ask the engineer for information

-AI is not aware of you when it is rejoining the track and subsequently knocks you off
-AI cars which need to be lapped do not get out of the way most of the time, therefore endangering your race
-The rev counter on the in-game steering wheel is still wrong, just like last year
-When exiting the pits with the pit assist option deactivated you are stuck in 2nd gear, therefore you lose a lot of time
-The AI is always, and I repeat ALWAYS faster than you in a straight line, I have had Mclaren-Hondas pull away from me whilst I am driving a Force India and using DRS
-2015 and 2014 car balance is not correct: 2015: Mclaren, Red Bull, Sauber too strong; Mercedes powered cars too weak (The cars are correctly balanced when you are driving them, but not when the AI is driving them, 2014: Mclaren is too powerful, haven't tested the rest (Again the AI cars are not balanced for example the Marussia is not runnung in the back like the Caterhams are)
-There are alot of races where the weather is grey and dark and it is raining, but the track dosen't look wet and the dry tires work significatly better than the intermediates
-The AI like to drive away from you in a train most of the time and you don't have a chance due to them blitzing down the straights
-The damage model is pathetic and way too forgiving most of the time
-The side pod glitch has kinda moved to the area between the sidepod and the front wheels, touch a car there and you just spin
-The fuel mode menu is too slow, so that it takes too long to switch between modes whilst driving
-The talk to the engineer menu" dissapears way to quickly after opening it
date: therefore rendering it useless\n-No tire smoke when youn lock tyres
hoursPlayed: therefore there are no immersive "trying to avoid an incident which has occured ahead" moments\n-Blury graphics and motion blur really strain the eyes after ~30 mins\n-When it start raining and you have to change ti intermidiate tyres and you do so on your schedueled pit stop and haven't used the menu to select the intermidiate tyres
voteText: you will have slicks put on during the pit stop
helpfulPercent:
this affects the AI most of the time too
-DRS is often enabled in wet conditions
-A lot of scenarios where you better of with slicks on a wet track

All in all the actual racing have vastly improved over last years game

reviewText:
Well here we go again.
The second racing title in a few months to basically be broken out of the Box. Maybe F1 2015 and Project Cars are part of a elaborate joke on the sim racing enthusiast world. (I use Sim lightly, both are not sims)

After Headaches from Project Cars bugs, I was hoping for a racing game that would have less bugs. Now have 2 frustrating games that have rediculous issues.

Getting booted from MP on the Grid as race starts - (Others have reported also)
Even a Banned message when trying to Start a Custom MP Race - (Restart Game fixes).
Wheel feedback almost non existent out of the box - (tweaking required but still not happy with it but better than default)
AI running up your back, they are meant to be F1 drivers not the general public. - (I can get run into from Multiplayer). Useless button config menu's. - (After so many F1 titles you would think they would know users want to change these)
Sound is so low I need to turn volume on speakers up full to hear, even after setting in game.
Graphics should look crisper but no they are blurry.
No-one playing Multiplayer or at least can't find games in Australia.
In Multiplayer Lobby as new players enter countdown restarts from 60 sec (get to 5 seconds to go, new player enters back to 60 second countdown)

Just not happy with look and feel (Would get refund but bought from 3rd Party)

Lets just hope Codemasters F1 Team will patch and fix issues quicker than Project Cars has.

A complete disapointment at the moment

reviewText:
Has crashed twice in about five minutes.
Missing Career mode and a host of other well liked features from the previous games (no career and no safety car for instance). Codemasters had an opportunity here to put together the best of all previous titles. A new engine and a mid season release for the first time. Sadly that opportunity is wasted. Hopefully these missing modes will get patched in and the crashing and other graphical anomalies fixed. This game is also missing the speculated day 1 patch. Would not recommend this game in it's current state.
After the snafu that was Batman Arkham Knight, one would imagine publishers and developers would be particular about releasing sub-standard titles or at least in a buggy state. Clearly this isn't the case. I skipped 2014 because I thought they would bring all the advances made there to this release. I was mistaken.

In what I view as an attempt to simplify or streamline the process of getting into a car and racing. Much of the flexibility has been lost. Polish of a few features is appreicated, but not at the expense of removing other much appreciated game modes and configuration options. One has no need for the 2014 season when the game of the matching year is readily available. Given that F1 2014 offers more in terms of gameplayt than 2015, why would one want a severly stripped down version of 2014 in this year's title?

It is anything but a step forward. Avoid for now, perhaps forever.
Codemasters may need to try again in 2016, but I'll not give them the benefit of the doubt. Perhaps I'll try 2017 again.

reviewText: Everyone has an open mic because that's the only option. Can't mute people. Get kicked randomly from online games (it's the servers doing it, not people). Lag is a massive issue, like people are teleporting all over the ♥♥♥♥ing place. Positions aren't always correct, like i was third at one point and it said i was eighth, and then it said i was first and i won the race, then hate to wait 20 minutes for a guy that was still on lap 1 going 2mph to finish the race. No cool career mode where you have your own character. Acceleration and braking online with a controller has no sensitivity, so you either tap it a little and it'll accelerate massively or not. Every time someone joins the lobby, an extra minute is added to the launch time. When you tab out, the resolution of the game ♥♥♥♥s up and the size goes all weird, resulting in you having to go back to settings and change it all to 1920x1080 etc. Not user friendly. Doesn't give you a description of what some game modes are. No tutorial. Characters look worse than Garry's mod characters. Got a headache from foreigners talking to their families while racing, and hearing them tapping their buttons away. This was all within 90 minutes of playing.

reviewText:
Looks have improved, if not amazing, but better. To my mind it feels enjoyable and challenging with all assists off.

Now here's the rub, forgetting the lack of features, because as far as I am concerned, if this game played as it should, I'd have overlooked that being this is a rewritten engine etc.

There are a few bugs and niggles but I have played many of the other games and for all their faults there was never a problem with the force feedback. This game has so little sensation of wheel weight or contact with road surface. and I have a wheel that works fine with previous games. So how many weeks will I have to wait before my wheel gives me the proper sensation of racing? I have posted so much on the forum, and yet nothing. All I ask is that it works with my steering wheel like it used to. Or like it does with project cars to be honest, as that does a better job.

Till then I won't recommend it to anyone and Codemasters really let me down this time and I'm usually a patient gamer.

*edit: I have a new wheel now, (T300) and the feeling is better with this wheel, but I am still not happy with this game overall. The feedback is passable, but should be better and have much more flexible option to adjust. Thing is, this is a console game first and a PC game second, which is a shame. Codemasters support for this game is almost non-existant as well, and the same errors creep into the game year on year.

I hope that from the news I am hearing, Codemasters are going to focus on their key franchises from here on in, and if they want my help, they will get it. The potential has always been there, F1 one on early -access anyone? Maybe we will get that telemetry we have wanted for ages after all.

????! It is very messed up!

The Bad:
1- I cannot change the car realism settings (damage and stuff)

If you have F1 2014... then do NOT get this game until they fix their controller support and the other settings issues. I'm very glad I didn't uninstall the previous game.

It is very amazing how anyone can mess up a very good game in a year.  CodeMasters, please fix it asap. Thank you.

The game can be summed up in one word. Wow.

Can't recommend the game at all for now, but hopefully CM will sort the issues so I can change my tune a bit.

reviewText:
I like it. It's not perfect but once i'm in a session i really enjoy it.

I play with traction control set to med all other assists off. Hopefully i can turn this off soon too!

My system is:

i7 2600k
16gb ram (I use dim drive and load the game into ram)
R9 380 4gb
Driving force gt wheel and pedal set

Cons:
Weather forecast for race weekend missing, i can't set my car up for the race in qualifying if i don't know what the weather forecast is.
DRS open conformation would be nice too, maybe flashing like it used to.
Benchmark test crashes the game.
No career mode (would be nice to have for some people but i play full race weekends over and will probably only get 2 full seasons out of it before 2016 is released)


Pros:
Force feedback is good. Tied in with that is the tire model. It took me an hour to get to grips with the game but once i did, i combined what i felt through the wheel with what i thought the car was doing and what the tire and brake temps were to drive the car. Now my tires generally surpass the initial pit window estimate while only losing 1.5-2 secs at end of life. I'm very rarely hard on the gas or brake anymore.
I like the penalty system over old versions of the game as it is now more lenient and just give warnings for minor contact rather than a tour of the pits.
i enjoy the commentary as well.

Formation lap, different cut videos, etc, would be nice but i don't feel like they would add significant value to the experience.

If you like f1 and are thinking about it, buy it!

reviewText: Completely underwhelming in comparison to Project Cars. Following install the game failed to start, blank screen for a few minutes and then thrown back to the desktop.  After a couple more tries I restarted my computer and the game finally loaded.  I set everything to Ultra and then ran benchmark.  Noticed the left rear tyre flashing in out of existence when the camera was following my car from behind, minor glitch maybe.  Seeing that my 980Ti easily delivered around 120fps 1440p I decided to engage vsync to limit the game to 60fps as there is no point wasting all that electricity on all those extra frames.  Graphically the game looks a bit cartoonish to me and feels more like an arcade game than a simulation. Hitting walls and other cars doesn't seem to cause any harm or damage, which kind of suprised me as F1 2010 definately felt like a simulation and in my view remains the better game.  On completing a quick race I noticed some rather more serious screen glitches in the post race sequences, though again I expect this will be fixed in future updates or drivers.  Also the replays seem to be fixed at 30fps which is strange. After another quick flick through the menus and not finding anything new of interest I had a quick race around Monaco and found this offered little excitment.  On quitting the game I was presented with Steam error 41; which is a new one for me; something about servers being overloaded or something but to be honest by this point I was beyond caring.  It remains disappointing that Codemasters do not support my old Microsoft Sidewinder wheel and peddles; particuarly given that Project Cars does; so instead I have to use an Xbox joypad. For me this speaks volumes about the quality of the games, attention to detail and the values of this company.  Overall, if you are formula one nut and have a compatible steering wheel then maybe you'll enjoy this game but anyone who has played Project Cars will feel completely underwhelmed by quality of this game.

reviewText:
The game is really not that bad as it sounds, and it would definitely deserve a good rating, once the bugs are fixed.

The game does some thing right of course and it's not all bad. You do have the new engine which is pretty great graphically, the new physics are really good and it's really fun to play. The AI is also better then the years before. They drive more agressively (i.e. attack you on the outside of a corner etc.) and make less misstakes just by themselves, but of course also try to overtake you with smokeing tyres sometimes. Good job there. But then you run into a bug...

And that's the problem, there are many bugs, which sometimes prevent you from even finishing a race (getting stuck in the pits or something like that). There are some other glitches which are pretty annoying. Some people even say, that the game crashes from time to time, which, I must say, has never happened to me so far. But there is one dealbreaker which makes game game bad right now...

Multiplayer on PC simply is not playable. 90% of the time, you don't even find a lobby and when you do, most of the times the game gives you a disconnect just short before the start of the race.

So is the game bad? No it's not, it's just not out of beta test as of now. There is a really strong foundation here, and it would really be a good game, once all the bugs are fixed. So my verdict is:
If you just want to play single player and enjoy good racing against AI, you could get the game if you don't mind a bug here or there... You could of course also wait till the bugs are fixed.
If, however, you want to play multiplayer, don't get it! Wait till the bugs are confirmed to be fixed, and then you have yourself a good game to play.
voteText: 9 of 16 people (56%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
There is a lot of trash talk and dissapointment about this game. I think it deserves better reviews. Sure, the lack of the progressive season mode is a shame but when you get past that, the improvements far outweight that small negative (that said, I don't do multiplayer so have no opinion on pro's or cons).

The physics of the car are out of this world. I had F1 2013 and it felt like the car was on rails. The F1 2015 cars feel like they are on the edge when you're lapping. You can FEEL the understeer and oversteer through the wheel and putting together a fast lap is very rewarding as the physics will punish you for over-doing things.

Tyre degradation and fuel management are now in your hands. You can slow down a tad and save tyres and fuel to change your race strategy. There is no option to change strategy before the race starts but you aren't forced" to pit like in F1 2013. If you choose to race flat out
date: you will have to make an extra stop compared to a more conservative approach..\n\nThe only other oddity is the AI speed. On Hard
recommended: it's fairly easy to qualify and race in the top three. Moving up to Expert
hoursPlayed: I was struggling to get in the top ten. Hopefully they'll patch it to make the gap a bit less radical. The AI also has a propensity to punt you off the track from time to time. Generally they race very well and you can force them into mistakes but it's very irritating to be on the correct line and suddenly "BOOM" you're spinning off the track.\n\nI highly recommend giving it a try. If you are bent out of sdhape by the lack of the young driver program you are missing out on a great racing sim for something that was only a fraction of the game."
voteText: December 2, 2015

reviewText:
Reading all these negative reviews I'm not sure if I'm playing the same game as the rest of the people here.

My PC specs are i7 4770k. 16GB RAM and a single 780GTX.  I haven't experience any crashes, any problems with button assignments, any technical difficulties what so ever.  I play the game on 5760 x 1080 and it runs at 60FPS with everything on ultra (or whatever the highest setting is)

The only issues with the game is setting up the force feedback, it's very mellow to start off with and it does take a couple of hours to set it up properly. AI is way too aggressive, they seem to crash at me randomly completely wiping me out.

I play the game using the G27 wheel.

The game is quite challenging on Legend difficulty, but I'm not sure what's causing all these technical difficulties for people.

But this S.O.B of a game just does not work properly, and you've nixed loads of features that had no business being removed. I don't know if you panicked because you figured this game was your last chance to redeem yourself, but you picked a terrible time to mess up. I regret buying this thing, and I've really enjoyed the F1 series up to now. Hopefully you can iron out some of the bugs and glitches, but it's the missing features that confuse me the most. I have no idea what you were thinking. Better luck next time chaps.

reviewText:
This game seems designed for fans of actual racing.  This game really drew me into it's world, but it didn't feel very fun to me.  The cars seem realistic, but it felt more like work.  That may be a great thing, but the journey toward being really skilled has to feel fun.

The game has a wide variation of skill levels, but I couldn't find that sweet spot for me, somewhere between the 3d racing lines that I wish I never experienced (it felt like it was way too spoonfed), and pro where the cars tires feel a little too much like butter to be real (maybe it's actually realism, I'm not sure).

Although I don't personally recommend the game, I could see some people having fun with this game.

Also, if you're looking for awesome crashes, this is not your game.

reviewText: An abomination of a game. I won’t even begin to mention all the missing features, the overly aggressive AI that takes great pleasure in ramming you off the road. Nor will I mention the fact that AI cars are just as fast going down the straight with DRS as they are without, or the fact that the engineer is downright useless, and will only inform you of weather and what tires the others are on, if he feels like it. Which is quite rarely.\nNo the worst part is trying to finish the Chinese Grand Prix, again, and again and again – and just for the hell of it, one more time. But I can’t because random crashes are random. The only positive about them are, you’re pretty much guaranteed to have them. Don’t make my mistake, don’t buy this. Please for your own, and the future of the franchise, stay clear like Maldonado on a slightly greasy track, or dry – Just don’t go near Crashtor.\n

reviewText:
I tried this game today as it is free for the weekend.  Let's see.  Graphics no better than the previous games.  Unintuitive and unattractive menus.  Multiplayer menu / lobby system is confusing and badly designed.  All Codemasters have to do is look at how other developers do it, and copy them.  But no, Codemasters seem to think they know better.  They don't.   No easy universal option to mute other  players voice chat in multiplayer, which is enabled by default.  The only way to do it is choose 'mute all' EVERY time you play a game.  It will not remember your setting.  And if another player joins after you chose this option, you will have to manually go and mute them too.  What a pathetically bad design.

Multiplayer has unacceptably long delays compared to other racing games I've played.  Long delays annoy people and are not conducive to keeping players playing, we have other things to do, rather than stare at screens for minute after minute after minute waiting, and waiting, and waiting.  There should be short timers so that if someone isn't ready yet then it's too bad, he shouldn't be able to keep the rest of the players waiting forever.

In my first race online I got bashed off at the first corner and while I know this can happen in any racing game online, what is not acceptable is the fact that *I* received a WARNING for the contact.  Me.  A warning for something which wasn't my fault and was out of my control.

Uninstalled.

reviewText:
Broken promises sprinkled with loads of chromatic aberration.

Stay away from this game.

Codemasters have promised an awesome game based on a so-called next-generation brand new engine, improving over the previous iterations with you feeling complete immersion of the middle of the racing action, further improved by the 'live broadcast' commentary.

What did we get then, you might ask?

A pathetic excuse for an AAA video game. The engine is anything but a complete rewrite still having bugs that have been around since 2010, the game is crashing, there's a distinct lack of game modes compared to the previous titles, no career mode and a broken multiplayer mode, no safety car, cringe-inducing commentary, the penalty system is still a joke punishing you for things you haven't done (like the AI ramming you from behind), the graphics completely suck only because Codemasters once again felt like this is some freaking Instagram or something and had to put in their filters making it look like a blury mess with a cherry on top in the form of chromatic aberration which you cannot turn off. It's making my eyes bleed, rendering the broken game even more unplayable.

The handling model might be a bit better than before, but other than that? No, just don't get this game. They don't deserve your money. They're going to talk on and on about how they are looking into the things people report and they do care about the players and community, but of course, nothing happens in the end and their promises of updating the game throughout the season resulted in them creating lame PR excuses about how the current engine is not capable of anything and they are going to improve things in the next game in the series which we all should totally purchase as soon as it's possible.

Sod off, Codemasters.

reviewText:
Broken with the same issues as its predecessors. Codemasters are incapable of making a good racing game these days. I got this free with a purchase of a laptop and even then I'm disappointed with it.

The graphics look good on my gaming PC, better than F1 2013 (the last one I bought) and there are no issues there other than it can look cartoony due to the colour saturation. The driving is very smooth and for the most part the game plays at well over 60 fps on max settings, but there are cases where the performance just goes through the floor. And I don't mean consistently either, you can lap a track several times with no issues and then for whatever reason, on the following lap, the framerate will halve and stay there, feeling like a slideshow after playing at 80 fps or higher.

The cars are very easy to drive and there's no real difificulty from the AI that I have seen. I have most of the assists off and use a gamepad, but the game doesn't seem to ever save my assist settings so I don't know if it reset my assists back to all enabled. I raced against medium AI around a couple of tracks and won the majority of races. Bear in mind I was in the Mercedes so a slower car would have faced more difficulty.

The game is very light on features. There's no career, no online co op, no split screen (co op or otherwise) and I'm sure there's more missing. The session browser list for online is gone, instead there are hopper lobbies which take ages to fill up or are always empty. Once you're in an online game, it takes ages to load everyone in and once you're racing the poor penalty system will ruin your fun. Just had a race where I covered someone off on the inside line, they corner cut to overtake, hit me and take us both into the gravel and I got the penalty. Had another after that where I go to turn, accidentally tag somebody so I turn out to prevent causing an accident, still get the penalty (other player did spin though). If it weren't for the poor penalty system that seems too happy to dish out penalties I'd be more likely to recommend this game.

This game also features non-existant force feedback. I can run over curbs and things and get no feedback from the controller. By comparison, Project Cars, you feel everything. I don't know what's good about this game really. Barebones features, poor penalty system, struggle to find games, takes ages to load everyone in, awful sound design, and not all that fun. 5 out of 10 at best

reviewText:
**Revwiew for PC** with GTX 760 (i7) - mostly medium to low settings @ minimum 58 fps.

If your a fan of F1 but were a bit fed up with the prior Codemasters F1 efforts then you have to get this game.
Great graphics, much improved AI, excellent replays with variable camera angles, adjustable cockpit camera angle, and wonderfully immersive physics ! The key to this game is understanding , as far as I have found out, is that the game is intended to be driven with 360* of wheel rotation unlike the prior gen console versions that I have played. This will give you 1:1 steering ratio when set up in your Logitech, or other branded, wheel profiler. Setting up my DFGT did take a bit more effort than ususal but feels great now. Big step up codemasters ! Well done !

reviewText:
First and foremost - most of the negativity is people having issues with their various wheels and controllers not working, that is not an active reflection of the game and they should go to Codemasters' blog for a fix, instead of giving the game bad rep.

Secondly, there are lots of bugs, yes but the majority of the game-breaking ones are fixed and the game is actually a pleasure to play. I do however hope to see the ones that are in the game still ironed out and I do NOT forgive Codemasters for releasing a broken game.

Third, I would like to comment on the gameplay, it is vastly improved on the 2014 game and it feels like a true racing experience and I enjoy the game a lot whether it is online or offline, with or without bugs, as most of the bugs when I'm playing are just hilarious anyway.

Fourth, I'm with the whole community when they say they want their REd Flags and their Safety Car back in the game as they made the experience that more real when playing and they are essential in the game, especially where the AI are dumb in Monaco. I'd love to see a parade lap that's toggleable and I'd really enjoy a bump in the difficulty of the game when you're in the better cars on the grid, as it seems a little easy to convert poles into wins on high overtake capacity tracks when you're in cars such as Ferrari and Mercedes.

Overall, yes I recommend this game, however make sure that you have a compatable controller or wheel prior to buying it, I use a wireless Xbox 360 controller and some cheap reciever and they're okay. It's fun and if you don't mind waiting for some features or for bugs to be fixed then definitely pick this game up.

reviewText:
I've only just bought this game and I'm loving it. Driving as Jenson Button, I have just completed the Australian GP on full race distance...no frame rate dips whatsoever, a smooth 60fps for 58laps. Handling is so improved and thus helps with consistency. Tyre wear is also more accurate with timely information from your engineer as to the state of your tyres...I got 14 laps out of the 'option' tyres and easily got 18 laps out of the 'prime' tyres before I had to pit. A.I. is more competitive and they make mistakes too...24 race incidents after the Australian GP!
The engineer is vastly improved, not only does he give consistent, accurate information on tyre wear, he also informs you of fuel use, weather, lap times and time gaps between your nearest rivals.
Graphically, it's an improvement over F1 2014 but it's no real showcase for next generation graphics. Crowd and officials are still oddly static and cardboard like, but that's only seen in the replays. Tracks are nicely detailed and accurate, although I noticed some 'blocky' trees and foliage, and I'm running the game on Ultra High settings.
Commentary is limited to before and after the race...it's serviceable, it gets the job done!
Replays are better as you can now cycle through all the cars in the race and watch them racing...something Psygnosis could do back in the 90's with their F1 game on PS1...but it's a nice addition. Only wish they would add a UI over the replays that gave you the lap, driver, laptimes etc.
I could mention everything that's missing, but I won't because a 100,000 other people have probably already done that across the internet. I love the game so far and it is easily the best F1 game Codemasters have created yet!

*Edit...maybe I've been fortunate, but I have encountered no bugs or glitches so far and I have now completed Round 2 The Malaysian GP! My system is high-spec but that wouldn't matter if there were bugs and glitches...I'm sorry for all purchasers who are having issues with the game and I sincerely hope you get them resolved soon!

reviewText:
Don't buy if you want to use a joystick. On my machine I map joystick y- to accelarate and y+ to brake and save this config. However, the game 'forgets' this config and sets both accelarate and brake to y-. The end result? A car that is both trying to accelarate and brake at the same time.

Given that joysticks are a popular control method on the PC, I find it inexcusable that Codemaster's QA team somehow missed this.

I got mine refunded.

For me this is a first. I have 73 Steam games and this is the first one that I have ever had to ask for a refund for. Shame on you Codemasters.

reviewText:
Update: There has now been a couple of patches and in fairness this review should be updated. The crashfest which was the released F1 2015 has been fixed and now seems stable. After testing the latest patch (22/7) I did not get any appcrashes or the notorious error 41.
The AI has improved (IMHO) and doesn't rear end your car with monotonous frequency. It still happens but mostly as a result of excessively hard braking into a corner. The game still has issues with fault though, expect to be blamed for every collision whether or not you were on line and in front into a corner.
Some of the menu operations are awkward such as the car setup pad". Having to type in a save filename everytime gets tedious especially when you just want to update and overwrite an existing setup.
I find now the racing pretty enjoyable. I don't have any particular problem with blur (@2560x1440) that some have mentioned and get a solid 60fps on a GTX980ti at absolutely maximum settings. I found the graphics initially appeared washed out with poor contrast which I tweaked up with sweetfx and now looks good to my eye (this may not necessarily be the game but an Nvidia driver issue). There is no sli support as yet. Control options are still very poor. I still can't get my wheel working but have sorted out a decent 360 controller setup after manually editing the file. Value of this F1 2015 over F1 2013 (I've skipped 2014) is debatable. Graphically it is moderately better but other than that losses out in features (and my wheel works in 2013). After the crash fixes I'd recommend it with a few caveats.

reviewText:
The issue:
My framerate is a solid 60-ish per second. About 2 times per lap, it drops to somewhere around 12 to 15 fps, stays there for 10 seconds, and goes back up again. This happens both in the benchmark as in the championship mode, with cars from both the 2015 and 2014 season.

System Specs:
Windows 7 SP1 64-bit
CPU: AMD Vishera FX-8350, Eight-Core,
Motherboard: ASUS M5A78L-M/USB3
RAM:  Crucial Ballistix Sport 12GB DDR3-1600,
Video card: Nvidia GTX 750 Ti 2GB,
Hard Drive: 1000 GB Sata III
Driving equipment: Using the pedals of the Thrustmaster F430, with the wheel of the Logitech Driving Force GT

DX Diag: http://www.mediafire.com/download/zb49cwq0cexnqr5/DxDiag.txt ;

Steps to reproduce
Simply enter a race (Tested with Australian Grand Prix) or run the benchmark.


What have I  done to try to fix the problem?
Given that I earlier reported some issues on DiRT Rally too, I wanted to check my system first.

Since that other bug report of mine, I've reinstalled Windows, made sure no other major processes were running in the background (Other than Steam)
I've opened up my PC case and cleaned it of any dust (There wasn't much, which wasn't a suprise considering it's not even a year old and well-maintained)
I've kept an eye on the PC temperatures while playing several games, it never reaches oddly high temperatures (Never above 60 degrees celcius in GTA V on pretty high settings, for example)
I have turned down the graphics settings and ran without V-sync to test it.
I've checked whether there was a driver update avaliable for my PC. There wasn't.

How long was your current session?
I've had several sessions. Some were short, with me going in the menu and starting the benchmark straight away. Also I've tried running a 100% race weekend, which I ran till about 50% of the race and saved there because the issues were really annoying me.

reviewText: Game is blurry...I tried recommended settings from other users in forums and even at 1920X1080 with all graphical settings set to Ultra, SAA off, post process and motion blur set to lowest it looks like I'm playing in 800X600. What a bad pc port this game is.

reviewText:
The driving and racing side of F1 2015 is very good.  There is a sence of control that is a level above the previous releases and that is the main thing about a racing game.

There are two negatives.  I suspect both are fairly straight forward to address.  The 1st is the online experience in the hoppers is very poor.  The lobby does not tell you what is going on very well.  The countdown to start seems to reset itself.  The vote to skip track countdown replaces the countdown to start, which seems to reset itself again.  The 2nd is GUI elements to navigate the game.  I'm a PC user with a G27 wheel.  On some screens, console buttons (X, B, Y, etc) appear.


These are both quality issues rather than gameplay.  The online hopper issue seems to really affect gamers decision whether to stay or leave in my opinion and it feels quite broken from a accessibilty POV.  The GUI navigation issues are presentation issues which do not affect actually navigating through the game.  The standard keyboard controls still work.

The single player mode is solid.  The annoying forced learning to control the car from the previous is gone.  I'm personally happy that the career mode is gone.  It wasn't really challenging and was a grind for achievements.  I'm enjoying the handling elements a lot.  The game engine is solid.

..just remembered 1x game play quirk.  Yellow flag incidents.  ie:  accident happens, you'll hear immediately from your race engineer that the incident is cleared, event before the car has finished spinning.

reviewText:
I like this game! I realise I'm in the minority here, but if you give me a moment I'll clarify my point of view.

First of all, this game is not perfect. It has bugs. It has missing features (you don't have a player career mode, you can't drive as yourself, there are practise sessions still missing). But what it lacks in features it makes up for in the racing.

The races are good! Okay, if you drive as Lewis Hamilton, you're quickly going to take the lead and drive away from the pack. But f you choose, say, Button's McLaren or a Sauber, you're going to have a race on your hands to reach your teams goal (which is usually to finish in the top 10).

The AI are pretty decent, they will give you a tough fight, they no longer back out of overtaking in the braking zones, and they'll go for small gaps.

I've noticed a bug where you're sometimes called into the pits on the same lap as your team mate and have to stack up behind, but it doesn't happen all the time. And you can get around it by pitting a lap later.

Weather modelling is about the same as always, so no problems there.

The damage could do with being a bit more sensitive. I crashed into a driver who braked suddenly in front of me, and I suffered no damage even with full damage enabled. Front wings need to be more fragile.

Aside from these problems, which are easy enough to work around, it's a good game. Is it the best F1 game ever? No, not by a long shot. But it's OK.

Don't expect too much. Go into it expecing a no frill, no nonsense F1 racing game. It's not a full on sim, but it's not an arcade game either.

reviewText:
I've never written a game review before but felt compelled to after all the negative reviews on here.  I had some initial issues with menus/graphics but now the game seems to be running smoothly (at least on my rig) here are some thoughts:

1. Graphics - much has been made on here of the blurring and I experienced this myself initially.  Once I realised the game was selecting the onboard graphics by default rather than my dedicated graphics card I was able to change my card settings and it was like playing a different game.  On ultra settings the game is visually very good and the sense of speed is palpable.
2. Control - I'm one of those troglodytes who still uses the keyboard so I can't comment on the gamepad/wheel issues experienced by others.  Keyboard preset 2 appears to be unusable due to some glitch in the handling when you select that preset but using the standard keyboard setup the handling is very good.
3. AI - a lot has also been made of cars running into the back of you in races.  In the quick race I tried, the only time someone ran into the back of me was when I made a stupid driving error.  Otherwise the cars behind behaved very well and the pressure of the pack breathing down my neck really added to the feel of the game.

Overall I would give this a big thumbs up.  Hopefully the bugs will be rectified quickly so that everyone can enjoy the experience.

reviewText:
Update for September 3rd patch
Many improvements have been made, fixing car glitches, crashes, settings, and controls. Almost all original issuses have been fixed. The only thing that really still remains (for me) is blue flag issues. I feel better recommending this game in the state it is now compared to what it was like on release.

Codemasters really put out a good game, and they are continuing to work on it. It should have shipped without most of these issues, but they are doing a really good job fixing them when they come up. Thanks for the game Codies. Well done.


Original Review
F1 2015 is a really good game. In fact, I would have to say it's the best in a while, despite the flaws.

Clearing things up:
Championship Mode IS Career Mode. You just don't race as yourself. Is that so bad?
It's not supposed to be a complete sim. Its supposed to have an arcade feel. Want it to feel real? Go driving.
You always have really needed a pad or wheel for F1 games. Keyboard has never worked (well).
Whats hot:
New engine, nice to get away from the past few titles graphics wise. Looks great too.
AI are majorly improved. They actually race you, and the other AI. Treat them well and you can have great battles.
Also includes 2014. May seem like a gimmick, but it does add extra playability with the (somewhat old) cars and tracks.
Leaderboards you can take setups from in Time Trial.
Restart lap and quick car/track swapping from menus in Time Trial.
Pro Season mode is an immersive, enjoyable way to race if you have some time and skill.
Tyre wear is better, I was able to push longer than previous games.
Much better fuel managment, I have never ran out of fuel in a race until now.
Whats not:
Big one first. Multiplayer. It simply doesn't work. Not big for me, but huge for most.
Button maps in menus are bad. X to go back on menus, B to go forward (for me, MadCatz Xbox Wireless Racing Wheel)
Downshift to second when leaving pits. Really, really annoying.
No safety car.
Bad career mode settings. Why can't I have 25% race with full qualifying?
Extremely varying track limits in Time Trial. You can cut the first corner at Hockenheim but God forbid you run a tad wide on exit.
Occasional crash on startup.
Trys to launch game after closing it.
Numerous other glitches (No tyres, invisible car, etc.)
I'm having fun with F1 2015. I figure I will continue to have fun with it. You can get past the glitches, and the game is completely playable. Despite the 66% negative reviews at the time of writing, I think that this game is really good. I plan to sink many an hour into battling with the AI and setting top times.

In my opinion F 1 2015 is a gem of a game to start.You have to believe that with this (core) next gen style format is
bound to get better period.It's been over three weeks since the games release with multiple patches added and each time
various issues have been fixed.So what I'm saying is, lets all of us do our part to assist CM in delivering the best F 1 racer
ever by continuing feedback and being a little more  patient than we have been in the past .First on the assist/feedback list is ensure that you have the latest drivers for everything that's connected to your PC,( Vid ,sound,MS update,steam client,verify integrity software,wheel /game pad drivers,etc ). reviewText:
As a gamepad user, this has the best controls on a Codies F1 game yet - FAR ahead of both 2013 and 2014

Outside of the controls, the AI is better (it doesn't give-up places even on lower difficulties) and the track bounds are tougher on corner-cutters which is long overdue.

The cars also seem to model aero better, you can feel the car digging-into fast turns and being committed matters more than it did in earlier games

Trail braking (braking into a corner) is punished more now - you need to be tidier, you can't save your mistakes so easily!!

Graphics are certainly more detailed but they're also pretty demanding - i5 4440/650 Ti Boost sees 45-60fps on med/high settings which isn't brilliant but isn't as bad as it sounds/is perfectly playable (and lowering settings doesn't really improve fps numbers anyway)

An outstanding bug seems to be your own engine being too quiet (other cars actually drown it out in all but cockpit view) but that's teaching me to look at the revcounter instead of trusting my ears (these hybrids aren't really designed to be revved-out to the limiter anyway)

I did have a couple of crashes (to desktop that is!!) but a Verify Game Files" sorted those out.

I don't really play online so I can't comment on that

I'm happy tho - as a pad player
